thread.title: Clinton joked about being hacked by the Chinese
thread.title_full: Clinton joked about being hacked by the Chinese | Washington Examiner

author: W. James Antle III
title: Clinton joked about being hacked by the Chinese
text:
Secretary of State Hillary Clinton joked about the Chinese hacking into her email in an exchange with a State Department aide.
Nora Toiv, then the special assistant to the counselor and chief of staff, emailed Clinton and Huma Abedin her Gmail address in July 2011. Clinton replied that she only had that address and asked for her State Department email address.
"You've always emailed me on my State email," Toiv wrote back, sending her the address.
"Even weirder — I just checked and I do have your state but not your gmail — so how did that happen," Clinton said in reply, quipping, "Must be the Chinese!" Toiv jokingly agreed.
  Poll: Scott Walker's slide in Wisconsin continues Wisconsin Gov. Scott Walker's slide in his home state continues, even after leaving the presidential race.
By Ryan Lovelace • 09/30/15 7:01 PM Critics of Clinton's use of a private email account and homebrew server while secretary of state warned that this arrangement could make her communications more vulnerable to foreign hackers.
The exchange was part of the Clinton emails released by the State Department Wednesday.
